event.name: Super Bowl Party
proTips: Stock beer by the quarter: Q1 (30%), Q2 (25%), Q3 (20%), Q4 (25%) of total consumption.
ALWAYS have 15% extra beer cold and ready - overtime games increase consumption by 50%.
Use halftime to restock ALL coolers - you have exactly 25 minutes.
Heavy food like wings and nachos reduces alcohol consumption by 15%.
Light beers disappear fastest - they're easier to drink during a 4-hour game.
event.buyingGuide: This is a beer event, period. Stock 70% light/domestic beers and 30% craft/premium options. Have coolers pre-staged in multiple locations so guests can grab drinks without blocking the TV. Buy ice in bulk - you'll need 3lbs per person for a Super Bowl party.

meta.title: How Much Spirits for 250 Guest Super Bowl Party? | 50 bottles
meta.description: Need spirits for a 250-person super bowl party? You'll need exactly 50 bottles. Free calculator with pro tips from experienced bartenders.
meta.h1: How Much Spirits for a 250 Guest Super Bowl Party?

mathExplanation.label: Estimate actual drinkers
mathExplanation.explanation: At xlarge events, about 65% of guests typically drink alcohol.

mathExplanation.label: Calculate base consumption
mathExplanation.explanation: Industry standard is 1.5 drinks per person per hour for a 5-hour event.

mathExplanation.label: Apply consumption decay
mathExplanation.formula: Adjusted for drinking slowdown over time (decay factor: 3.75)
mathExplanation.explanation: People drink faster in the first hour and slow down as the event progresses.

mathExplanation.label: Apply super bowl party modifier
mathExplanation.explanation: Super Bowl Partys typically consume 20% less spirits than average.

mathExplanation.label: Convert to bottles
mathExplanation.explanation: Each bottle of spirits provides 17 servings.

mathExplanation.label: Add 15% buffer & round up
mathExplanation.explanation: Always round up and add a buffer. Running out is worse than having leftovers!
